trans-unit.target: ឬតើអ្នកគិតថាអ្នកនឹងចូលសួនមនោរម្យខណៈពេលដែលការ [ការកាត់ទោស] ដូចជាមិនទាន់មកដល់អ្នកដែលជាអ្នកបានចូលមកដល់ពួកអ្នកដែលបានកន្លងផុតទៅនៅលើមុនពេលដែលអ្នក?

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what they should spend. Say, "Whatever you spend of good is [to be] for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it."
trans-unit.target: គេសួរអ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad] អ្វីដែលពួកគេគួរតែចំណាយ។

trans-unit.source: Fighting has been enjoined upon you while it is hateful to you. But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not.
trans-unit.target: ការប្រយុទ្ធគ្នាត្រូវបានបង្គាប់ដល់អ្នករាល់គ្នាខណៈពេលដែលវាជាការគួរអោយស្អប់ខ្ពើមដល់អ្នក។

trans-unit.source: They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting therein. Say, "Fighting therein is great [sin], but averting [people] from the way of Allah and disbelief in Him and [preventing access to] al-Masjid al-Haram and the expulsion of its people therefrom are greater [evil] in the sight of Allah. And fitnah is greater than killing." And they will continue to fight you until they turn you back from your religion if they are able. And whoever of you reverts from his religion [to disbelief] and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេបានសួរអ្នកអំពីខែពិសិដ្ឋ - អំពីការប្រយុទ្ធគ្នានៅទីនេះ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់អ្នកដែលបានជឿហើយអ្នកដែលបានធ្វើអន្តោប្រវេសន៍និងបានប្រយុទ្ធក្នុងបុព្វហេតុនៃព្រះអាឡស់នេះ - អ្នកដែលរំពឹងថានឹងបានសេចក្ដីមេត្ដាករុណានៃព្រះអាឡស់បាន។

trans-unit.source: They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, "In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit." And they ask you what they should spend. Say, "The excess [beyond needs]." Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might give thought.
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេបានសួរអ្នកអំពីស្រានិងល្បែង។

trans-unit.source: To this world and the Hereafter. And they ask you about orphans. Say, "Improvement for them is best. And if you mix your affairs with theirs - they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the amender. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: ដើម្បីពិភពលោកនេះនិងអំណើះតទៅ។

trans-unit.source: And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not marry polytheistic men [to your women] until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite [you] to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.
trans-unit.target: និងមិនរៀបការជាមួយស្ត្រី polytheistic រហូតដល់ពួកគេជឿ។

trans-unit.source: And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation. And do not approach them until they are pure. And when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordained for you. Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves."
trans-unit.target: ហើយពួកគេសួរអ្នកអំពីការមករដូវ។

trans-unit.source: Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish and put forth [righteousness] for yourselves. And fear Allah and know that you will meet Him. And give good tidings to the believers.
trans-unit.target: ប្រពន្ធរបស់អ្នកគឺជាកន្លែងនៃការសាបព្រួសគ្រាប់ពូជសម្រាប់អ្នក, ដូច្នេះមកដល់កន្លែងរបស់អ្នកនៃការដាំដុះទោះជាយ៉ាងណាអ្នកចង់ហើយបាន [សេចក្ដីសុចរិត] សម្រាប់ខ្លួន។

trans-unit.source: And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse against being righteous and fearing Allah and making peace among people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: កុំធ្វើឱ្យ [ស្បថរបស់អ្នក] ព្រះអាឡស់លេសប្រឆាំងនឹងការធ្វើជាអ្នកកោតខ្លាចព្រះអាឡស់សុចរិតនិងសន្ដិភាពនៅក្នុងចំណោមនិងធ្វើឱ្យប្រជាជនមួយ។

trans-unit.source: Allah does not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He imposes blame upon you for what your hearts have earned. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអាឡស់មិនបានដាក់ការស្តីបន្ទោសលើអ្នកចំពោះអ្វីដែលជាការស្បថរបស់អ្នកនៅដោយអចេតនានោះទេប៉ុន្តែលោកបានដាក់ការស្តីបន្ទោសលើអ្នកសម្រាប់អ្វីដែលចិត្តរបស់អ្នកបានទទួលបាន។

trans-unit.source: For those who swear not to have sexual relations with their wives is a waiting time of four months, but if they return [to normal relations] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: សម្រាប់អ្នកដែលស្បថមិនឱ្យមានទំនាក់ទំនងផ្លូវភេទជាមួយនឹងប្រពន្ធរបស់គេគឺជាពេលវេលារង់ចាំបួនខែ, ប៉ុន្តែប្រសិនបើពួកគេបានវិលត្រឡប់មកវិញ [ទំនាក់ទំនងធម្មតា] - បន្ទាប់មកពិត, ព្រះអាឡស់គឺអភ័យទោសនិងអាណិតអាសូរ។

trans-unit.source: And if they decide on divorce - then indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើពួកគេសម្រេចចិត្តលើការលែងលះគ្នា - បន្ទាប់មកពិត, ព្រះអាឡស់គឺត្រូវសវនាការនិងដឹង។

trans-unit.source: Divorced women remain in waiting for three periods, and it is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their husbands have more right to take them back in this [period] if they want reconciliation. And due to the wives is similar to what is expected of them, according to what is reasonable. But the men have a degree over them [in responsibility and authority]. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: ស្ត្រីដែលបានលែងលះគ្នានៅតែក្នុងរយៈព​​េលបីរង់ចាំឱ្យហើយវាមិនមែនជាច្បាប់សម្រាប់ពួកគេដើម្បីលាក់នូវអ្វីដែលព្រះអាឡស់បានបង្កើតឡើងនៅក្នុងពោះរបស់ពួកគេប្រសិនបើពួកគេជឿថានៅក្នុងព្រះអាឡស់និងថ្ងៃចុងក្រោយ។

trans-unit.source: Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment. And it is not lawful for you to take anything of what you have given them unless both fear that they will not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah. But if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: ការលែងលះគ្នាគឺពីរដង។

trans-unit.source: And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him. And if the latter husband divorces her [or dies], there is no blame upon the woman and her former husband for returning to each other if they think that they can keep [within] the limits of Allah. These are the limits of Allah, which He makes clear to a people who know.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើគាត់បានលែងលះគ្នានាង [ជាលើកទីបី], បន្ទាប់មកនាងមិនមានសិទ្ធិកាត់ក្រោយមករហូតដល់ [បន្ទាប់ពី] នាងរៀបការជាមួយនឹងប្តីផ្សេងទៀតជាងគាត់។

trans-unit.source: And when you divorce women and they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or release them according to acceptable terms, and do not keep them, intending harm, to transgress [against them]. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah in jest. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: ហើយនៅពេលដែលអ្នកលែងលះគ្នាស្ត្រីហើយពួកគេបាន [ជិត] បានបំពេញអាណត្តិរបស់ខ្លួនទាំងរក្សាពួកគេនេះបើយោងតាម​​លក្ខខណ្ឌអាចទទួលយកបានឬដោះលែងពួកគេនេះបើយោងតាម​​លក្ខខណ្ឌអាចទទួលយកបាននិងមិនរក្សាពួកគេមានបំណងះថាក់, ដើម្បីប្រព្រឹត្ដល្មើស [ប្រឆាំងនឹងពួកគេ] ។

trans-unit.source: And when you divorce women and they have fulfilled their term, do not prevent them from remarrying their [former] husbands if they agree among themselves on an acceptable basis. That is instructed to whoever of you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is better for you and purer, and Allah knows and you know not.
trans-unit.target: ហើយនៅពេលដែលអ្នកលែងលះគ្នាស្ត្រីហើយពួកគេបានបានបំពេញអាណត្តិរបស់ពួកគេមិនបានរារាំងពួកគេពីការរៀបការម្តងទៀត [អតីត] ប្តីរបស់ពួកគេប្រសិនបើពួកគេយល់ព្រមក្នុងចំណោមខ្លួនឯងនៅលើមូលដ្ឋានអាចទទួលយកបាន។

trans-unit.source: Mothers may breastfeed their children two complete years for whoever wishes to complete the nursing [period]. Upon the father is the mothers' provision and their clothing according to what is acceptable. No person is charged with more than his capacity. No mother should be harmed through her child, and no father through his child. And upon the [father's] heir is [a duty] like that [of the father]. And if they both desire weaning through mutual consent from both of them and consultation, there is no blame upon either of them. And if you wish to have your children nursed by a substitute, there is no blame upon you as long as you give payment according to what is acceptable. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Seeing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: ស្ត្រីជាម្តាយអាចបំបៅដោះកូនរបស់ខ្លួនពីរឆ្នាំពេញលេញសម្រាប់អ្នកណាដែលមានបំណងដើម្បីបញ្ចប់ការថែទាំ [រយៈពេល] ។

trans-unit.source: And those who are taken in death among you and leave wives behind - they, [the wives, shall] wait four months and ten [days]. And when they have fulfilled their term, then there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable manner. And Allah is [fully] Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: និងអ្នកដែលត្រូវបានគេយកនៅក្នុងការស្លាប់ក្នុងចំណោមអ្នកហើយទុកឱ្យប្រពន្ធនៅពីក្រោយការ - ដែលពួកគេ [ប្រពន្ធនោះនឹង] រង់ចាំរយៈពេលបួនខែដប់ [ថ្ងៃ] ។

trans-unit.source: There is no blame upon you for that to which you [indirectly] allude concerning a proposal to women or for what you conceal within yourselves. Allah knows that you will have them in mind. But do not promise them secretly except for saying a proper saying. And do not determine to undertake a marriage contract until the decreed period reaches its end. And know that Allah knows what is within yourselves, so beware of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: មានការស្តីបន្ទោសនោះទេសម្រាប់អ្នកដែលនៅលើគឺជាការដែលអ្នក [ដោយប្រយោល] allude ពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹងសំណើរទៅនឹងស្ត្រីឬសម្រាប់អ្វីដែលអ្នកបានលាក់ខ្លួនមួយ។

trans-unit.source: There is no blame upon you if you divorce women you have not touched nor specified for them an obligation. But give them [a gift of] compensation - the wealthy according to his capability and the poor according to his capability - a provision according to what is acceptable, a duty upon the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: មានការស្តីបន្ទោសមកលើអ្នកនោះទេប្រសិនបើអ្នកលែងស្ត្រីអ្នកមិនបានប៉ះពាល់ឬបញ្ជាក់សម្រាប់ពួកគេជាកាតព្វកិច្ចមួយ។

trans-unit.source: And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already specified for them an obligation, then [give] half of what you specified - unless they forego the right or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract foregoes it. And to forego it is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget graciousness between you. Indeed Allah, of whatever you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើអ្នកលែងពួកគេមុនពេលដែលអ្នកបានប៉ះពួកគេនិងអ្នកបានបញ្ជាក់រួចទៅហើយសម្រាប់ពួកគេជាកាតព្វកិច្ច, បន្ទាប់មក [ឱ្យ] ពាក់កណ្តាលនៃអ្វីដែលអ្នកបានបញ្ជាក់ - លុះត្រាតែពួកគេបានសិទ្ធិឬមួយនៅក្នុងដៃគឺជាកិច្ចសន្យាអាពាហ៍ពិពាហ៍ foregoes វា។

trans-unit.source: Maintain with care the [obligatory] prayers and [in particular] the middle prayer and stand before Allah, devoutly obedient.
trans-unit.target: រក្សាបាននូវការមើលថែ [ក​​ាតព្វកិច្ច] អធិស្ឋាននិង [ជាពិសេសនៅក្នុង] ការអធិស្ឋានកណ្តាលនិងឈរនៅចំពោះព្រះអាឡស់, ចេះស្ដាប់បង្គាប់ devoutly ។

trans-unit.source: And if you fear [an enemy, then pray] on foot or riding. But when you are secure, then remember Allah [in prayer], as He has taught you that which you did not [previously] know.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើអ្នកខ្លាច [មារសត្រូវបន្ទាប់មកសូមអធិស្ឋាន] នៅលើជើងឬជិះ។

trans-unit.source: And those who are taken in death among you and leave wives behind - for their wives is a bequest: maintenance for one year without turning [them] out. But if they leave [of their own accord], then there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable way. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: និងអ្នកដែលត្រូវបានគេយកនៅក្នុងការស្លាប់ក្នុងចំណោមអ្នកហើយទុកឱ្យប្រពន្ធនៅពីក្រោយ - សម្រាប់ប្រពន្ធរបស់ពួកគេគឺ bequest មួយ: ការថែរក្សាសម្រាប់មួយឆ្នាំដោយមិនងាក [ពួកគេ] ចេញ។

trans-unit.source: And for divorced women is a provision according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.
trans-unit.target: និងសម្រាប់ស្ត្រីប្ដីលែងគឺជាការផ្តល់មួយនេះបើយោងតាម​​អ្វីដែលជាការទទួលយកបាន - កាតព្វកិច្ចលើមនុស្សសុចរិតទេ។

trans-unit.source: Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you might use reason.
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះមិនអល់ឡោះធ្វើឱ្យច្បាស់លាស់ដល់អ្នកខគម្ពីររបស់លោកដែលថាអ្នកអាចប្រើហេតុផល។

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who left their homes in many thousands, fearing death? Allah said to them, "Die"; then He restored them to life. And Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people do not show gratitude.
trans-unit.target: តើអ្នកមិនចាត់ទុកថាជាអ្នកដែលបានចាកចេញពីផ្ទះរបស់ពួកគេនៅក្នុងការរាប់ពាន់នាក់ដោយខ្លាចស្លាប់?

trans-unit.source: And fight in the cause of Allah and know that Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: និងការប្រយុទ្ធក្នុងបុព្វហេតុនៃព្រះអាឡស់និងបានដឹងថាព្រះអាឡស់គឺត្រូវសវនាការនិងដឹង។

trans-unit.source: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him many times over? And it is Allah who withholds and grants abundance, and to Him you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: វាថានឹងផ្តល់ប្រាក់កម្ចីប្រាក់កម្ចីយ៉ាងល្អប្រណីតព្រះអាឡស់ដូច្នេះគាត់អាចគុណវាសម្រាប់គាត់ជាច្រើនលើកជាអ្នកណា?

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered the assembly of the Children of Israel after [the time of] Moses when they said to a prophet of theirs, "Send to us a king, and we will fight in the way of Allah "? He said, "Would you perhaps refrain from fighting if fighting was prescribed for you?" They said, "And why should we not fight in the cause of Allah when we have been driven out from our homes and from our children?" But when fighting was prescribed for them, they turned away, except for a few of them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: តើអ្នកមិនបានចាត់ទុកថាជាការជួបប្រជុំនៃកុមារនៃជនជាតិអ៊ីស្រាអែលបន្ទាប់ពីការ [ពេលវេលានៃការ] លោកម៉ូសេនៅពេលដែលពួកគេបាននិយាយទៅកាន់ព្យាការីរបស់គេមួយ "ផ្ញើទៅឱ្យពួកយើងស្តេចហើយយើងនឹងប្រយុទ្ធប្រឆាំងនៅក្នុងវិធីនៃព្រះអាឡស់នេះ"?

trans-unit.source: And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, Allah has sent to you Saul as a king." They said, "How can he have kingship over us while we are more worthy of kingship than him and he has not been given any measure of wealth?" He said, "Indeed, Allah has chosen him over you and has increased him abundantly in knowledge and stature. And Allah gives His sovereignty to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing [in favor] and Knowing."
trans-unit.target: និងពួកហោរាបា​​នទាយទៅគេថា: «ជាការពិតណាស់ព្រះអាឡស់បានផ្ញើទៅអ្នកសូលជាស្ដេច»។

trans-unit.source: And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, a sign of his kingship is that the chest will come to you in which is assurance from your Lord and a remnant of what the family of Moses and the family of Aaron had left, carried by the angels. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers."
trans-unit.target: និងពួកហោរាបា​​នទាយទៅគេថា: «ជាការពិតណាស់សញ្ញានៃការសោយរាជ្យរបស់គាត់គឺថាទ្រូងនេះនឹងមកដល់អ្នកដែលមានការធានាពីព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់អ្នកនិងនៅសេសសល់មួយនៃអ្វីដែលក្រុមគ្រួសាររបស់លោកម៉ូសេនិងក្រុមគ្រួសាររបស់លោកអើរ៉ុនបានចាកចេញ, បានអនុវត្តដោយ

trans-unit.source: And when Saul went forth with the soldiers, he said, "Indeed, Allah will be testing you with a river. So whoever drinks from it is not of me, and whoever does not taste it is indeed of me, excepting one who takes [from it] in the hollow of his hand." But they drank from it, except a [very] few of them. Then when he had crossed it along with those who believed with him, they said, "There is no power for us today against Goliath and his soldiers." But those who were certain that they would meet Allah said, "How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the patient."
trans-unit.target: ហើយនៅពេលដែលព្រះបាទសូលបានចេញទៅជាមួយទាហាននោះលោកបាននិយាយថា: «ជាការពិតណាស់ព្រះអាឡស់នឹងត្រូវបានធ្វើតេស្តអ្នកជាមួយនឹងទឹកទន្លេ។ ដូច្នេះអ្នកណាផឹកពីវាមិនមែនជារបស់ខ្ញុំហើយអ្នកណាមិនភ្លក្សរសជាតិវាគឺជាការពិតពីខ្ញុំលើកលែងតែមួយដែលបានចំណាយពេល [

trans-unit.source: And when they went forth to [face] Goliath and his soldiers, they said, "Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: ហើយនៅពេលដែលពួកគេបានចេញទៅ [មុខ] កូលីយ៉ាតនិងពួកទាហានរបស់ពួកគេបាននិយាយថា: «បពិត្រព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់យើងបានចាក់មកលើយើងអត់ធ្មត់និងរោងចក្រយ៉ាងរឹងមាំជើងរបស់យើងនិងផ្ដល់អោយយើងមានជ័យជំនះលើមនុស្សដែលជឿ»។

trans-unit.source: So they defeated them by permission of Allah, and David killed Goliath, and Allah gave him the kingship and prophethood and taught him from that which He willed. And if it were not for Allah checking [some] people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted, but Allah is full of bounty to the worlds.
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះពួកគេបានផ្តួលពួកគេដោយមានការអនុញ្ញាតពីព្រះអាឡស់ហើយព្រះបាទដាវីឌសម្លាប់កូលីយ៉ាតហើយអល់ឡោះបានផ្ដល់ឱ្យគាត់រាជសម្បត្តិនិងព្យាការីនិងបង្រៀនគាត់ពីអ្វីដែលលោកបានប្រគល់។

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you, [O Muhammad], in truth. And indeed, you are from among the messengers.
trans-unit.target: ទាំងនេះគឺជាខគម្ពីរព្រះអាឡស់ដែលយើងបានសូត្រដើម្បីអ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad] នៅក្នុងសេចក្ដីពិត។

trans-unit.source: Those messengers - some of them We caused to exceed others. Among them were those to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degree. And We gave Jesus, the Son of Mary, clear proofs, and We supported him with the Pure Spirit. If Allah had willed, those [generations] succeeding them would not have fought each other after the clear proofs had come to them. But they differed, and some of them believed and some of them disbelieved. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He intends.
trans-unit.target: អ្នកនាំសារទាំងនោះ - ចំនួននៃពួកគេយើងបានបណ្តាលឱ្យលើសពីអ្នកដទៃ។

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, spend from that which We have provided for you before there comes a Day in which there is no exchange and no friendship and no intercession. And the disbelievers - they are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿចំណាយពីអ្វីដែលយើងបានផ្តល់សម្រាប់អ្នកមុនពេលដែលមានភ្ជាប់មកជាថ្ងៃដែលគ្មានគឺមានការផ្លាស់ប្តូរនិងមិត្តភាពទេហើយទូលអង្វរទេ។

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអាឡស់ - មានគឺជាអាទិទេពទេលើកលែងតែទ្រង់ដែលមិនធ្លាប់មានអមតៈទ្រទ្រង់អត្ថិភាព [ទាំងអស់] នេះ។

trans-unit.source: There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong. So whoever disbelieves in Taghut and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: មិនត្រូវមានការបង្ខិតបង្ខំនៅក្នុង [ការទទួលយក] សាសនានោះទេ។

trans-unit.source: Allah is the ally of those who believe. He brings them out from darknesses into the light. And those who disbelieve - their allies are Taghut. They take them out of the light into darknesses. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអាឡស់គឺជាសម្ព័ន្ធមិត្តរបស់ពួកអ្នកដែលជឿ។

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord [merely] because Allah had given him kingship? When Abraham said, "My Lord is the one who gives life and causes death," he said, "I give life and cause death." Abraham said, "Indeed, Allah brings up the sun from the east, so bring it up from the west." So the disbeliever was overwhelmed [by astonishment], and Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: តើអ្នកមិនបានចាត់ទុកមួយដែលអះអាងដោយមានលោកអប្រាហាំអំពីព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់គាត់ [គ្រាន់តែជា] ដោយសារតែព្រះអាឡស់បានប្រទានឱ្យទ្រង់មានអំណាចគ្រប់គ្រង?

trans-unit.source: Or [consider such an example] as the one who passed by a township which had fallen into ruin. He said, "How will Allah bring this to life after its death?" So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years; then He revived him. He said, "How long have you remained?" The man said, "I have remained a day or part of a day." He said, "Rather, you have remained one hundred years. Look at your food and your drink; it has not changed with time. And look at your donkey; and We will make you a sign for the people. And look at the bones [of this donkey] - how We raise them and then We cover them with flesh." And when it became clear to him, he said, "I know that Allah is over all things competent."
trans-unit.target: ឬ [ពិចារណាគំរូបែបនេះ] ជាអ្នកដែលបានអនុម័តដោយទីក្រុងដែលបានធ្លាក់ចូលទៅក្នុងប្រាសាទបុរាណមួយ។

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, show me how You give life to the dead." [Allah] said, "Have you not believed?" He said, "Yes, but [I ask] only that my heart may be satisfied." [Allah] said, "Take four birds and commit them to yourself. Then [after slaughtering them] put on each hill a portion of them; then call them - they will come [flying] to you in haste. And know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise."
trans-unit.target: និង [ការលើកឡើង] នៅពេលលោកអប្រាហាំទូលថា: «លោកម្ចាស់បង្ហាញខ្ញុំពីរបៀបដែលអ្នកផ្តល់ឱ្យជីវិតទៅនឹងការស្លាប់នេះ»។

trans-unit.source: The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed [of grain] which grows seven spikes; in each spike is a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies [His reward] for whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: ឧទាហរណ៍នៃអ្នកដែលបានចំណាយទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិរបស់ពួកគេនៅក្នុងវិធីនៃព្រះអាឡស់នេះគឺដូចជាគ្រាប់ពូជមួយ [ស្រូវ] ដែលដុះកើនឡើងនូវជាតិប្រាំពីរ;

trans-unit.source: Those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah and then do not follow up what they have spent with reminders [of it] or [other] injury will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: អស់អ្នកដែលបានចំណាយទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិរបស់ពួកគេនៅក្នុងវិធីនៃព្រះអាឡស់ហើយបន្ទាប់មកមិនអនុវត្តតាមអ្វីដែលពួកគេបានចំណាយពេលជាមួយនឹងការរំលឹក [របស់វា] ឬការរងរបួស [ផ្សេងទៀត] នឹងបានទទួលរង្វាន់របស់គេជាមួយនឹងព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ពួកគេហើយវានឹងមានការភ័យខ្លាចអំពីអស់គ្មានឆន្ទៈ

trans-unit.source: Kind speech and forgiveness are better than charity followed by injury. And Allah is Free of need and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: សុន្ទរកថាប្រភេទនិងការអភ័យទោសគឺល្អប្រសើរជាងសេចក្ដីស្រឡាញ់ដែលតាមពីក្រោយដោយរបួស។

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not invalidate your charities with reminders or injury as does one who spends his wealth [only] to be seen by the people and does not believe in Allah and the Last Day. His example is like that of a [large] smooth stone upon which is dust and is hit by a downpour that leaves it bare. They are unable [to keep] anything of what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿ, មិនឱ្យមានសុពលភាពការបរិច្ចាគរបស់អ្នកជាមួយនឹងការរំលឹកឬការរងរបួសដូចជាមនុស្សម្នាក់ដែលបានចំណាយទ្រព្យសម្បត្ដិរបស់គាត់ [តែ] ត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញដោយប្រជាជននិងមិនជឿថានៅក្នុងព្រះអាឡស់និងថ្ងៃចុងក្រោយ។

trans-unit.source: And the example of those who spend their wealth seeking means to the approval of Allah and assuring [reward for] themselves is like a garden on high ground which is hit by a downpour - so it yields its fruits in double. And [even] if it is not hit by a downpour, then a drizzle [is sufficient]. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: និងគំរូនៃអ្នកដែលចំណាយពេលស្វែងរកទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិរបស់ពួកគេមានន័យថាដើម្បីការអនុម័តនៃព្រះអាឡស់និងធានា [រង្វាន់សម្រាប់] ដោយខ្លួនឯងគឺដូចជាសួនមួយនៅលើដីខ្ពស់ដែលត្រូវបានវាយប្រហារដោយភ្លៀងមួយ - ដូច្នេះវាអាចទទួលទិន្នផលផ្លែឈើរបស់ខ្លួននៅក្នុងពីរដង។

trans-unit.source: Would one of you like to have a garden of palm trees and grapevines underneath which rivers flow in which he has from every fruit? But he is afflicted with old age and has weak offspring, and it is hit by a whirlwind containing fire and is burned. Thus does Allah make clear to you [His] verses that you might give thought.
trans-unit.target: តើមួយនៃអ្នកចង់ឱ្យមានសួនដើមចាកនិងចម្ការទំពាំងបាយជូរមានទន្លេហូរក្រោមដែលក្នុងនោះគាត់មានពីឈើជារៀងរាល់មួយ?

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim toward the defective therefrom, spending [from that] while you would not take it [yourself] except with closed eyes. And know that Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿពីអ្វីដែលល្អចំណាយដែលអ្នកបានទទួលនិងបានពីការដែលថាយើងបានផលិតឡើងសម្រាប់អ្នកពីផែនដីនេះ។

trans-unit.source: Satan threatens you with poverty and orders you to immorality, while Allah promises you forgiveness from Him and bounty. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: សាតាំងបានគំរាមកំហែងដល់អ្នកជាមួយនឹងភាពក្រីក្រនិងការបញ្ជាទិញឱ្យអ្នកប្រព្រឹត្តបានក្នុងខណៈពេលដែលព្រះអាឡស់សន្យាថាអ្នកលើកលែងទោសពីទ្រង់និងប្រាក់រង្វាន់។

trans-unit.source: He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever has been given wisdom has certainly been given much good. And none will remember except those of understanding.
trans-unit.target: ទ្រង់បានប្រទាននូវប្រាជ្ញាដែលលោកមានបំណងប្រាថ្នាដើម្បីអ្នកណា? ហើយអ្នកណាត្រូវបានគេដែលបានផ្ដល់ឱ្យប្រាជ្ញាបានពិតជាត្រូវបានផ្តល់ឱ្យបានល្អច្រើន។

trans-unit.source: And whatever you spend of expenditures or make of vows - indeed, Allah knows of it. And for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
trans-unit.target: ហើយអ្វីដែលអ្នកចំណាយនៃការចំណាយឬធ្វើឱ្យស្បថ - ពិត, ព្រះអាឡស់បានដឹងពីវា។

trans-unit.source: If you disclose your charitable expenditures, they are good; but if you conceal them and give them to the poor, it is better for you, and He will remove from you some of your misdeeds [thereby]. And Allah, with what you do, is [fully] Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: ប្រសិនបើអ្នកបានបង្ហាញការចំណាយសប្បុរសរបស់អ្នក, ពួកគេគឺល្អ;

trans-unit.source: Not upon you, [O Muhammad], is [responsibility for] their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever good you [believers] spend is for yourselves, and you do not spend except seeking the countenance of Allah. And whatever you spend of good - it will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: មិនមែនលើអ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad] គឺ [ការទទួលខុសត្រូវសម្រាប់ការ] ការណែនាំរបស់ពួកគេប៉ុន្តែព្រះអាឡស់ដែលព្រះអង្គសព្វព្រះហឫ​​ទ័យនាំ។

trans-unit.source: [Charity is] for the poor who have been restricted for the cause of Allah, unable to move about in the land. An ignorant [person] would think them self-sufficient because of their restraint, but you will know them by their [characteristic] sign. They do not ask people persistently [or at all]. And whatever you spend of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
trans-unit.target: [ជំនួយមនុស្ស Charity គឺ] សម្រាប់អ្នកក្រីក្រដែលត្រូវបានដាក់កម្រិតចំពោះមូលហេតុនៃព្រះអាឡស់មិនអាចផ្លាស់ទីអំពីការនៅក្នុងដី។

trans-unit.source: Those who spend their wealth [in Allah 's way] by night and by day, secretly and publicly - they will have their reward with their Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: អស់អ្នកដែលបានចំណាយទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិរបស់ពួកគេ [នៅក្នុងវិធីដែលអល់ឡោះបាន] ដោយយប់និងថ្ងៃសម្ងាត់និងជាសាធារណៈ - ពួកគេនឹងត្រូវទទួលរង្វាន់របស់គេជាមួយនឹងព្រះរបស់ពួកគេ។

trans-unit.source: Those who consume interest cannot stand [on the Day of Resurrection] except as one stands who is being beaten by Satan into insanity. That is because they say, "Trade is [just] like interest." But Allah has permitted trade and has forbidden interest. So whoever has received an admonition from his Lord and desists may have what is past, and his affair rests with Allah. But whoever returns to [dealing in interest or usury] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
trans-unit.target: អស់អ្នកដែលបានប្រើប្រាស់ប្រាក់មិនអាចឈរ [នៅថ្ងៃនៃការរស់ឡើងវិញ] លើកលែងជាការមួយឈរដែលត្រូវបានរងការវាយដំដោយសាតាំងបានចូលទៅក្នុងការ។

trans-unit.source: Allah destroys interest and gives increase for charities. And Allah does not like every sinning disbeliever.
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអាឡស់បំផ្លាញបានកើនឡើងហើយផ្តល់នូវការចាប់អារម្មណ៍សម្រាប់ការបរិច្ចាគ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds and establish prayer and give zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, អ្នកដែលជឿនិងការធ្វើប្រព្រឹត្ដអំពើសុចរិតនិងបង្កើតការអធិស្ឋាននិងការផ្តល់ឱ្យ zakah នឹងមានការទទួលរង្វាន់របស់គេជាមួយនឹងព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ពួកគេហើយវានឹងមានការភ័យខ្លាចអំពីអស់គ្មានពួកគេនឹងព្រួយ។

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of interest, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿភ័យខ្លាចព្រះអាឡស់និងផ្តល់ឱ្យនូវអ្វីដែលនៅតែ [ដោយសារតែអ្នក] នៃការចាប់អារម្មណ៍ប្រសិនបើអ្នកគួរតែមានអ្នកជឿ។

trans-unit.source: And if you do not, then be informed of a war [against you] from Allah and His Messenger. But if you repent, you may have your principal - [thus] you do no wrong, nor are you wronged.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើអ្នកធ្វើមិនបានន​​ោះត្រូវបានជូនដំណឹងនៃសង្រ្គាមមួយ [ប្រឆាំងនឹងអ្នក] ពីព្រះអាឡស់និងកម្មវិធីផ្ញើសាររបស់ទ្រង់។

trans-unit.source: And if someone is in hardship, then [let there be] postponement until [a time of] ease. But if you give [from your right as] charity, then it is better for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើនរណាម្នាក់គឺជាការលំបាក, បន្ទាប់មក [ឱ្យមាន] ការពន្យារពេលរហូតដល់ [ពេលវេលានៃការ] បន្ធូរបន្ថយ។

trans-unit.source: And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be treated unjustly.
trans-unit.target: និងការភ័យខ្លាចថ្ងៃមួយនៅពេលដែលអ្នកនឹងត្រូវបានត្រឡប់ទៅព្រះអាឡស់។

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you contract a debt for a specified term, write it down. And let a scribe write [it] between you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write and let the one who has the obligation dictate. And let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave anything out of it. But if the one who has the obligation is of limited understanding or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men. And if there are not two men [available], then a man and two women from those whom you accept as witnesses - so that if one of the women errs, then the other can remind her. And let not the witnesses refuse when they are called upon. And do not be [too] weary to write it, whether it is small or large, for its [specified] term. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is an immediate transaction which you conduct among yourselves. For [then] there is no blame upon you if you do not write it. And take witnesses when you conclude a contract. Let no scribe be harmed or any witness. For if you do so, indeed, it is [grave] disobedience in you. And fear Allah. And Allah teaches you. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿនៅពេលដែលអ្នកចុះកិច្ចសន្យាជាបំណុលសម្រាប់រយៈពេលដែលបានបញ្ជាក់មួយសរសេរវាចុះ។

trans-unit.source: And if you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe, then a security deposit [should be] taken. And if one of you entrusts another, then let him who is entrusted discharge his trust [faithfully] and let him fear Allah, his Lord. And do not conceal testimony, for whoever conceals it - his heart is indeed sinful, and Allah is Knowing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: ហើយប្រសិនបើអ្នកស្ថិតនៅលើដំណើរមួយនិងមិនអាចរកឃើញអាចារ្យម្នាក់, បន្ទាប់មកប្រាក់បញ្ញើសន្តិសុខ [គួរតែត្រូវបាន] យក។

trans-unit.source: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Whether you show what is within yourselves or conceal it, Allah will bring you to account for it. Then He will forgive whom He wills and punish whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: អល់ឡោះជាកម្មសិទ្ធិរបស់អ្វីដែលមាននៅលើមេឃនិងអ្វីដែលមាននៅលើផែនដីនេះ។

trans-unit.source: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], "We make no distinction between any of His messengers." And they say, "We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination."
trans-unit.target: កម្មវិធីផ្ញើសារនេះបានជឿលើអ្វីដែលបានបង្ហាញឱ្យគាត់ពីព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់គាត់ហើយ [ដូច្នេះ] ជឿ។

trans-unit.source: Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. "Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអាឡស់មិនគិតព្រលឹងមួយលើកលែងតែ [ជាមួយនឹងរយៈព​​េលដែលបាន] សមត្ថភាពរបស់ខ្លួន។

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Alif លោក Lam, Meem ។

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអាឡស់ - មានគឺជាអាទិទេពទេលើកលែងតែទ្រង់ដែលមិនធ្លាប់មានអមតៈទ្រទ្រង់ជីវិត។

trans-unit.source: He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.
trans-unit.target: ទ្រង់បានបញ្ជូនចុះមកលើអ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad] សៀវភៅក្នុងសេចក្ដីពិតបញ្ជាក់ថាអ្វីដែលជាការមុនពេលវា។

trans-unit.source: Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Qur'an. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.
trans-unit.target: មុនពេល, ជាការណែនាំសម្រាប់ប្រជាជន។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, from Allah nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់ពីអ្វីសោះព្រះអាឡស់ត្រូវបានលាក់នៅលើផែនដីឬនៅស្ថានបរមសុខដែរ។

trans-unit.source: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: វាគឺជាព្រះអង្គដែលបានបង្កើតអ្នកនៅក្នុងពោះទោះជាយ៉ាងណាលោកបានសព្វព្រះហឫ​​ទ័យនោះ។

trans-unit.source: It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, "We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord." And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.
trans-unit.target: វាគឺជាព្រះអង្គដែលបានចាត់ឱ្យចុះទៅអ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad] សៀវភៅនេះ;

trans-unit.source: [Who say], "Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.
trans-unit.target: [ដែលនិយាយថា] "ព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់យើងសូមឱ្យចិត្ដរបស់យើងមិនងាកបន្ទាប់ពីអ្នកបានដឹកនាំយើងហើយផ្តល់ឱ្យយើងពីខ្លួនឯងមេត្តាករុណា។ ជាការពិតណាស់អ្នកគឺជាអ្នកប្រទាននោះ។

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise."
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអម្ចាស់នៃយើងប្រាកដថាអ្នកនឹងប្រមូលមនុស្សសម្រាប់ទិវាអំពីការដែលមិនមានការសង្ស័យទេ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, អ្នកដែលមិនជឿ - មិនដែលនឹងទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិឬកូនរបស់ពួកគេទទួលពួកគេប្រឆាំងនឹងព្រះអាឡស់នៅទាំងអស់។

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: [ហើយជា] ដូចប្រពៃណីរបស់ប្រជាជននៃព្រះចៅផារ៉ោននិងអ្នកដែលមុនពេលពួកគេ។

trans-unit.source: Say to those who disbelieve, "You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place."
trans-unit.target: ចូរប្រាប់ដល់ពួកអ្នកដែលមិនជឿថា: «អ្នកនឹងត្រូវបានយកឈ្នះលើនិងប្រមូលផ្តុំគ្នាដើម្បីឋាននរកនិងការបរាជ័យគឺជាកន្លែងដែលនៅសល់។ "

trans-unit.source: Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.
trans-unit.target: រួចទៅហើយនៅទីនោះបានសម្រាប់អ្នកចូលកងទ័ពទាំងពីរដែលបានជួបមួយ - ការប្រយុទ្ធគ្នាមួយនៅក្នុងមូលហេតុនៃព្រះអាឡស់និងមួយផ្សេងទៀតនៃ disbelievers ។

trans-unit.source: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.
trans-unit.target: តាក់តែងសម្រាប់មនុស្សមានសេចក្ដីស្រឡាញ់របស់ដែលពួកគេចង់បាន - ស្ត្រីនិងកូនប្រុសបូក heaped ឡើងនៃមាសនិងប្រាក់សេះម៉ាកល្អនិងហ្វូងសត្វនិងដីដំណាំដុះសាជាថ្មី។

trans-unit.source: Say, "Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants -
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា: «អោយខ្ញុំប្រាប់អ្នកពី [អ្វីមួយ] បានល្អប្រសើរជាងនេះ? ចំពោះអ្នកដែលខ្លាចព្រះអាឡស់នឹងក្លាយជាសួនច្បារនៅក្នុងវត្តមាននៃព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ខ្លួនមានទន្លេហូរក្រោមដែលជាកន្លែងដែលពួកគេបានគោរពអស់កល្បជានិច្ចហើយបរិសុទ្ធប្តីប្រពន្ធនិងការយល់ព្រមពីអល់ឡោះ។ ហើយអល់ឡោះជា

trans-unit.source: Those who say, "Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,"
trans-unit.target: អស់អ្នកដែលបាននិយាយថា "ព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់យើង, ជាការពិតយើងបានជឿដូច្នេះអត់ទោសយើងអោយរួចពីបាបរបស់យើងនិងការពារយើងពីការផ្តន្ទាទោសនៃអគ្គីភ័យនេះ»

trans-unit.source: The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.
trans-unit.target: អ្នកជំងឺពិតដែលស្ដាប់បង្គាប់អ្នកដែលចំណាយពេល [នៅក្នុងវិធីនៃព្រះអាឡស់] ហើយអស់អ្នកដែលស្វែងរកការអត់ឱនទោសមុនពេលថ្ងៃរះ។

trans-unit.source: Allah witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: សាក្សីព្រះអាឡស់ដែលមានគឺជាអាទិទេពទេលើកលែងតែទ្រង់ហើយ [ដូច្នេះធ្វើ] ពួកទេវតានិងអ្នកដែលនៃចំណេះដឹង - [ថាទ្រង់គឺជា] រក្សាបាននូវ [បង្កើត] ក្នុងតុលាការ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, សាសនាចំពោះព្រះនេត្រនៃព្រះអាឡស់នេះគឺសាសនាអ៊ីស្លាម។

trans-unit.source: So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, "Have you submitted yourselves?" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះប្រសិនបើពួកគេប្រកែកជាមួយអ្នកនិយាយថា "ខ្ញុំបានដាក់ខ្លួនឯងដើម្បីព្រះអាឡស់ [នៅក្នុងសាសនាអ៊ីស្លាម] ហើយ [ដូច្នេះ] អស់អ្នកដែលតាមខ្ញុំ»។

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice from among the people - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: ពួកអ្នកដែលមិនជឿនៅក្នុងសញ្ញានៃព្រះអាឡស់និងសម្លាប់ពួកព្យាការីដោយគ្មានការត្រឹមត្រូវហើយសម្លាប់អស់អ្នកដែលបានបញ្ជាឱ្យកាត់ទោសពីចំណោមប្រជាជន - ផ្តល់ឱ្យពួកគេនូវដំណឹងនៃការដាក់ទណ្ឌកម្មឈឺចាប់។

trans-unit.source: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there will be no helpers.
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេជាអ្នកដែលបានក្លាយទៅជាគ្មានតម្លៃបានប្រព្រឹត្ដក្នុងពិភពលោកនេះនិងលោកខាងមុខនេះហើយសម្រាប់ពួកគេនឹងមានអ្នកជួយទេ។

trans-unit.source: Do you not consider, [O Muhammad], those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They are invited to the Scripture of Allah that it should arbitrate between them; then a party of them turns away, and they are refusing.
trans-unit.target: តើអ្នកពិចារណាមិនបាន, [ឱលោក Muhammad], អ្នកដែលត្រូវបានគេដែលបានផ្ដល់ឱ្យជាផ្នែកនៃបទគម្ពីរនេះ?

trans-unit.source: That is because they say, "Never will the Fire touch us except for [a few] numbered days," and [because] they were deluded in their religion by what they were inventing.
trans-unit.target: នោះហើយគឺដោយសារតែពួកគេបាននិយាយថា: «អគ្គិភ័យនេះមិនបានប៉ះនឹងយើងលើកលែងតែសម្រាប់ [ការពីរបី] ថ្ងៃដែលមានលេខ "ហើយ [ពីព្រោះ] ពួកគេត្រូវបានគេបញ្ឆោតនៅក្នុងសាសនារបស់ពួកគេដោយអ្វីដែលពួកគេត្រូវបានបង្កើត។

trans-unit.source: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no doubt? And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះតើវានឹងត្រូវបាននៅពេលដែលយើងបានប្រមូលផ្តុំគ្នាពួកគេសម្រាប់ទិវាអំពីការដែលមានការសង្ស័យទេមួយ?

trans-unit.source: Say, "O Allah, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា "ឱព្រះអាឡស់ជាម្ចាស់អធិបតេយ្យភាពអ្នកផ្តល់អធិបតេយ្យភាពដែលអ្នកនឹងហើយអ្នកយកអធិបតេយ្យភាពឆ្ងាយពីការដែលអ្នកនឹង។ អ្នកគោរពអ្នកអ្នកនឹងហើយអ្នកដែលមានចិត្ដរាបទាបដែលអ្នកនឹង។ នៅក្នុងដៃអ្នក [ទាំងអស់] ល្អ។ ជាការពិតណាស់,

trans-unit.source: You cause the night to enter the day, and You cause the day to enter the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living. And You give provision to whom You will without account."
trans-unit.target: អ្នកបណ្តាលឱ្យយប់នេះដើម្បីចូលទៅមួយថ្ងៃហើយអ្នកបង្កឱ្យមានថ្ងៃនេះដើម្បីចូលទៅក្នុងយប់នេះ!

trans-unit.source: Let not believers take disbelievers as allies rather than believers. And whoever [of you] does that has nothing with Allah, except when taking precaution against them in prudence. And Allah warns you of Himself, and to Allah is the [final] destination.
trans-unit.target: សូមកុំឱ្យអ្នកជឿយក disbelievers ជាសម្ព័ន្ធមិត្តជាជាងជឿ។

trans-unit.source: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah knows it. And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា "មិនថាអ្នកលាក់អ្វីដែលមានក្នុងសុដន់របស់អ្នកឬបង្ហាញវា, ព្រះអាឡស់ដឹងថាវា។ ហើយទ្រង់បានដឹងថាដែលមាននៅក្នុងមេឃនិងដែលមាននៅលើផែនដីនេះ។ ហើយអល់ឡោះជាជាងរឿងទាំងអស់សមត្ថកិច្ច។

trans-unit.source: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And Allah warns you of Himself, and Allah is Kind to [His] servants."
trans-unit.target: ទិវាព្រលឹងរៀងរាល់នឹងរកឃើញអ្វីដែលវាបានធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នល្អ [មុនពេលដែលវា] និងអ្វីដែលវាបានធ្វើការអាក្រក់វានឹងប្រាថ្នាថារវាងខ្លួនឯងនិងថា [អាក្រក់] គឺជាចម្ងាយយ៉ាងខ្លាំង។

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: និយាយថា, [ឱលោក Muhammad] "ប្រសិនបើអ្នកគួរតែស្រឡាញ់ព្រះអាឡស់, បន្ទាប់មកតាមខ្ញុំ [ដូច្នេះ] អល់ឡោះនឹងស្រឡាញ់អ្នកអត់ទោសអោយអ្នកនូវអំពើបាបរបស់អ្នក។ ហើយអល់ឡោះជាអ្នកអភ័យទោសនិងមេត្តាករុណា»។

trans-unit.source: Say, "Obey Allah and the Messenger." But if they turn away - then indeed, Allah does not like the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា "ចូរស្ដាប់បង្គាប់ព្រះអាឡស់និងកម្មវិធីផ្ញើសារនេះ»។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់ព្រះអាឡស់បានជ្រើសរើសអាដាមនិងលោកណូអេនិងក្រុមគ្រួសាររបស់លោកអប្រាហាំនិងក្រុមគ្រួសារនៃ "លោក Imran នៅលើពិភពលោក -

trans-unit.source: Descendants, some of them from others. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: កូនចៅរបស់ពួកគេមួយចំនួនពីអ្នកដទៃ។

trans-unit.source: [Mention, O Muhammad], when the wife of 'Imran said, "My Lord, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb, consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing."
trans-unit.target: [រៀបរាប់ឱលោក Muhammad] ភរិយានៃ "របស់ Imran បាននិយាយថា: «ឱព្រះអម្ចាស់ជាការពិតដែលខ្ញុំបានសន្យាថានឹងអ្នកអ្វីដែលជាការនៅក្នុងផ្ទៃខ្ញុំ, បានញែក [សម្រាប់សេវារបស់អ្នក], ដូច្នេះការទទួលយកនេះពីខ្ញុំ។ ជាការពិតណាស់អ្នកគឺជាសវនាការ

trans-unit.source: But when she delivered her, she said, "My Lord, I have delivered a female." And Allah was most knowing of what she delivered, "And the male is not like the female. And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allah]."
trans-unit.target: ប៉ុន្តែនៅពេលដែលនាងបានបញ្ជូននាងនាងនិយាយថា "ព្រះអម្ចាស់អើយខ្ញុំបានប្រគល់ស្ត្រីមួយ»។

trans-unit.source: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provision. He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?" She said, "It is from Allah. Indeed, Allah provides for whom He wills without account."
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់នាងបានទទួលយករបស់នាងជាមួយនឹងការទទួលយករបស់នាងបានល្អនិងបណ្តាលឱ្យកើនឡើងនៅក្នុងលក្ខណៈល្អមួយហើយដាក់របស់នាងនៅក្នុងការថែទាំសាការី។

trans-unit.source: At that, Zechariah called upon his Lord, saying, "My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication."
trans-unit.target: នៅពេលដែលលោកសាការីបានអំពាវនាវព្រះអម្ចាស់ថា: «ឱព្រះអម្ចាស់ជាផ្តល់ឱ្យខ្ញុំពីខ្លួនឯងជាពូជពង្សល្អ។ ជាការពិតណាស់អ្នកគឺជាអ្នកដែលស្ដាប់សេចក្ដីអង្វរនេះ»។

trans-unit.source: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, "Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allah and [who will be] honorable, abstaining [from women], and a prophet from among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះពួកទេវតាបានហៅគាត់ខណៈពេលដែលគាត់ត្រូវបានគេឈរនៅក្នុងការអធិស្ឋាននៅក្នុងបន្ទប់នោះថា: «ជាការពិតណាស់ព្រះអាឡស់ផ្តល់ឱ្យអ្នកនូវដំណឹងល្អយ៉ូហានបញ្ជាក់ព្រះបន្ទូលពីព្រះអាឡស់និងការ [ដែលនឹង] សុចរិតចៀសវាង [ពីស្ត្រី] ហើយពីចំណោមជាព្យាការី

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when I have reached old age and my wife is barren?" The angel said, "Such is Allah; He does what He wills."
trans-unit.target: លោកបាននិយាយថា: «បពិត្រព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ខ្ញុំតើខ្ញុំនឹងមានក្មេងប្រុសម្នាក់នៅពេលដែលខ្ញុំបានឈានដល់អាយុដែលមានអាយុមួយនិងប្រពន្ធរបស់ខ្ញុំគឺគ្មានកូន? "

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He Said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture. And remember your Lord much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."
trans-unit.target: លោកបាននិយាយថា: «បពិត្រព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ខ្ញុំធ្វើឱ្យសម្រាប់ខ្ញុំជាសញ្ញាមួយ "។

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: និង [ការលើកឡើង] នៅពេលដែលពួកទេវតាបាននិយាយថា "ឱម៉ារី, ជាការពិតព្រះអាឡស់បានជ្រើសរើសអ្នកនិង purified អ្នកនិងជ្រើសរើសអ្នកពីលើស្ដ្រីនៃពិភពលោកនេះ។

trans-unit.source: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer]."
trans-unit.target: ឱម៉ារី, ត្រូវចេះស្ដាប់បង្គាប់ព្រះអម្ចាស់ devoutly របស់អ្នកនិង prostrate និងបានអោនជាមួយនឹងអ្នកដែលបានអោន [ក្នុងការអធិស្ឋាន] »។

trans-unit.source: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.
trans-unit.target: នោះគឺពីដំណឹងនៃការដែលមើលមិនឃើញដែលយើងបានបង្ហាញដល់អ្នក [ឱលោក Muhammad] ។

trans-unit.source: [And mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: [ហើយការលើកឡើង] នៅពេលដែលពួកទេវតាបាននិយាយថា "ឱម៉ារី, ជាការពិតព្រះអាឡស់ផ្តល់ឱ្យអ្នកនូវដំណឹងល្អនៃពាក្យមួយពីទ្រង់ដែលមានឈ្មោះនឹងត្រូវបានព្រះមេស្ស៊ីព្រះយេស៊ូជាកូននា​​ងម៉ារី - កិត្តិយសក្នុងពិភពលោកនេះនិងអំណើះតទៅហើយក្នុងចំណោមអ្នកដែលនាំ

trans-unit.source: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous."
trans-unit.target: ទ្រង់នឹងមានបន្ទូលទៅកាន់មនុស្សដែលនៅក្នុងលំយោលនិងនៅក្នុងកាលកំណត់ហើយនឹងត្រូវរបស់មនុស្សសុចរិត»។

trans-unit.source: She said, "My Lord, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] said, "Such is Allah; He creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
trans-unit.target: នាងបាននិយាយថា "ព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ខ្ញុំតើខ្ញុំនឹងមានកូននៅពេលដែលគ្មាននរណាម្នាក់បានពាល់ខ្ញុំ? »

trans-unit.source: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel
trans-unit.target: ហើយទ្រង់នឹងបង្រៀនគាត់សរសេរនិងប្រាជ្ញានិងវិន័យនិងដំណឹងល្អ

trans-unit.source: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel, [who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of Allah. And I cure the blind and the leper, and I give life to the dead - by permission of Allah. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.
trans-unit.target: និង [ធ្វើឱ្យគាត់] កម្មវិធីផ្ញើសារទៅកាន់ជនជាតិអ៊ីស្រាអែលមួយ [ដែលនឹងនិយាយថា] "ពិតណាស់ខ្ញុំបានមករកអ្នកដោយមានសញ្ញាមួយពីព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់អ្នកនៅក្នុងការរចនាប្លង់ខ្ញុំសម្រាប់អ្នកពីដីឥដ្ឋ [ដែលប] ដូចជាសំណុំបែបបទនៃការមួយ

trans-unit.source: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: និង [ខ្ញុំបានមក] បញ្ជាក់ថាអ្វីដែលជាការមុនខ្ញុំរបស់គម្ពីរវិន័យនិងដើម្បីធ្វើឱ្យច្បាប់សម្រាប់អ្នកមួយចំនួននៃអ្វីដែលត្រូវបានគេហាមឃាត់មិនឱ្យអ្នក។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is the straight path."
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់អល់ឡោះជាព្រះអម្ចាស់និងព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់អ្នកខ្ញុំដូច្នេះថ្វាយបង្គំទ្រង់។

trans-unit.source: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them, he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters for Allah. We have believed in Allah and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].
trans-unit.target: ប៉ុន្តែនៅពេលដែលព្រះយេស៊ូវបានមានអារម្មណ៍ថា [តស៊ូ] បណ្ដុះការមិនជឿពីពួកគេថា: «តើនរណាជាអ្នកគាំទ្ររបស់ខ្ញុំសម្រាប់ [មូលហេតុនៃការ] ព្រះអាឡស់? "

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger Jesus, so register us among the witnesses [to truth]."
trans-unit.target: ព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់យើង, យើងបានជឿលើអ្វីដែលអ្នកបានបង្ហាញហើយមកតាមអ្នកនាំសារព្រះយេស៊ូវនេះ, ដូច្នេះយើងនៅក្នុងចំណោមសាក្សីចុះឈ្មោះនេះ [ទៅនឹងការពិត] »។

trans-unit.source: And the disbelievers planned, but Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners.
trans-unit.target: និង disbelievers ដែលបានគ្រោងទុកនោះទេប៉ុន្តែព្រះអាឡស់ដែលបានគ្រោងទុក។

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when Allah said, "O Jesus, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you [in submission to Allah alone] superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.
trans-unit.target: [រៀបរាប់] នៅពេលដែលព្រះអាឡស់បាននិយាយថា: «ឱព្រះយេស៊ូ, ជាការពិតខ្ញុំនឹងទទួលយកអ្នកនិងបង្កើនអ្នកទៅកាន់ខ្លួនឯងនិងជំរះអ្នកពីអ្នកដែលមិនជឿនិងការធ្វើឱ្យអស់អ្នកដែលតាមអ្នក [នៅក្នុងការចុះចូលចំពោះព្រះអាឡស់តែម្នាក់ឯង] ល្អគ្មានគូប្រៀបទៅនឹងអ្នកដែលមិនជឿរហូតដល់ថ្ងៃ

trans-unit.source: And as for those who disbelieved, I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers."
trans-unit.target: រីឯអ្នកដែលមិនជឿនាងឡើយខ្ញុំនឹងដាក់ទោសពួកគេជាមួយនឹងការផ្តន្ទាទោសធ្ងន់ធ្ងរនៅក្នុងពិភពលោកនេះនិងអំណើះតទៅ, ហើយពួកគេនឹងមានអ្នកជួយទេ»។

trans-unit.source: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: រីឯអស់អ្នកដែលបានជឿហើយបានធ្វើការប្រព្រឹត្ដអំពើសុចរិតនោះទ្រង់នឹងផ្តល់ឱ្យពួកគេនៅក្នុងពេញលេញរង្វាន់របស់ពួកគេហើយអល់ឡោះមិនចូលចិត្តអ្នកដែលធ្វើខុសនោះទេ។

trans-unit.source: This is what We recite to you, [O Muhammad], of [Our] verses and the precise [and wise] message.
trans-unit.target: នេះជាអ្វីដែលយើងបានសូត្រដើម្បីអ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad] នៃខ [របស់យើង] និងសារ [និងប្រាជ្ញា] បានច្បាស់លាស់។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allah is like that of Adam. He created Him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, ឧទាហរណ៍របស់លោកយេស៊ូដើម្បីព្រះអាឡស់គឺដូចអាដាម។

trans-unit.source: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.
trans-unit.target: ការពិតគឺបានមកពីព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់អ្នក, ដូច្នេះមិនស្ថិតក្នុងចំណោមសង្ស័យ។

trans-unit.source: Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars [among us]."
trans-unit.target: បន្ទាប់មកអ្នកណាអះអាងថាជាមួយអ្នកអំពីវាបន្ទាប់ពីចំនេះដឹង [នេះ] បានមកដល់អ្នក - និយាយថា "សូមអញ្ជើញមកសូមឱ្យយើងហៅកូនប្រុសរបស់យើងនិងកូនចៅរបស់អ្នក, ស្ត្រីរបស់យើងនិងស្ត្រីរបស់អ្នក, ខ្លួនយើងនិងខ្លួន, បន្ទាប់មកអង្វរដោយស្មោះ [ជាមួយគ្នា] និងដកហូត

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this is the true narration. And there is no deity except Allah. And indeed, Allah is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់នេះជារឿងនិទានពិត។

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away, then indeed - Allah is Knowing of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: ប៉ុន្តែប្រសិនបើពួកគេបានក្លាយទៅឆ្ងាយ, បន្ទាប់មកពិត - ព្រះអាឡស់គឺការដឹងពីអំពើពុករលួយ។

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allah." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា "ឱប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះមកដល់ពាក្យមួយដែលមានសមភាពរវាងពួកយើងនិងអ្នក។ - ថាយើងនឹងមិនថ្វាយបង្គំព្រះអាឡស់និងមិនលើកលែងតែអ្វីនោះទេជាមួយទ្រង់សេពគប់និងមិនយកគ្នាជាម្ចាស់ជំនួសឱ្យព្រះអាឡស់"

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: មនុស្សដែលមានចែងទុកក្នុងគម្ពីរអើយហេតុអ្វីបានជាអ្នកជជែកតវ៉ាអំពីអ័ប្រាហាំខណៈពេលដែលគម្ពីរវិន័យនិងដំណឹងល្អនេះមិនត្រូវបានបង្ហាញរហូតដល់បន្ទាប់ពីគាត់?

trans-unit.source: Here you are - those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge, but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allah knows, while you know not.
trans-unit.target: នៅទីនេះអ្នកមាន - ពួកអ្នកដែលបានអះអាងអំពីការដែលថាដែលអ្នកបានចំណេះដឹង [មួយចំនួន] ប៉ុន្តែហេតុអ្វីបានជាអ្នកបានជជែកតវ៉ាអំពីការដែលថាដែលអ្នកមានចំណេះដឹងទេ?

trans-unit.source: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was one inclining toward truth, a Muslim [submitting to Allah]. And he was not of the polytheists.
trans-unit.target: អ័ប្រាហាំមិនមែនជាសាសន៍យូដាគ្មានគ្រីស្ទានមួយប៉ុន្តែគាត់មានទំនោរចិត្ដចំពោះសេចក្ដីពិតមួយ, មូស្លីម [ការដាក់ស្នើទៅកាន់ព្រះអាឡស់] ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to Allah] and this prophet, and those who believe [in his message]. And Allah is the ally of the believers.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, មានភាពសក្ដិសមច្រើនបំផុតនៃលោកអ័ប្រាហាំនៅក្នុងចំណោមមនុស្សគឺអស់អ្នកដែលដើរតាមព្រះអង្គទៅ [នៅក្នុងការចុះចូលចំពោះព្រះអាឡស់] និងព្យាការីនេះហើយអស់អ្នកដែលជឿថា [នៅក្នុងសាររបស់លោក] ។

trans-unit.source: A faction of the people of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: បក្សពួករបស់ប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរទាំងនោះមានបំណងចង់ពួកគេអាចបំភាន់អ្នក។

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while you witness [to their truth]?
trans-unit.target: ឱប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះហេតុអ្វីបានជាអ្នកមិនជឿក្នុងខនៃព្រះអាឡស់ខណៈពេលដែលអ្នកធ្វើបន្ទាល់ [ដល់សេចក្ដីពិតរបស់ពួកគេ]?

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, why do you confuse the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know [it]?
trans-unit.target: ឱប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះហេតុអ្វីបានជាអ្នកច្រឡំពីសេចក្តីពិតជាមួយនឹងការកុហកនិងការលាក់ការពិតខណៈពេលដែលអ្នកដឹងថា [វា]?

trans-unit.source: And a faction of the People of the Scripture say [to each other], "Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end that perhaps they will abandon their religion,
trans-unit.target: និងបក្សពួករបស់ប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះបាននិយាយថា [ទៅគ្នាទៅវិញទៅមក] «សូមជឿថាការដែលត្រូវបានគេបង្ហាញឱ្យដឹងដល់អ្នកជឿនៅដើមនៃថ្ងៃហើយបដិសេធវានៅចុងបញ្ចប់របស់ខ្លួនថាប្រហែលជាពួកគេនឹងបោះបង់ចោលសាសនារបស់ខ្លួន

trans-unit.source: And do not trust except those who follow your religion." Say, "Indeed, the [true] guidance is the guidance of Allah. [Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?" Say, "Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah - He grants it to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Wise."
trans-unit.target: និងការមិនទុកចិត្តលើកលែងតែអ្នកដែលបានតាមសាសនារបស់អ្នក។ "និយាយថា" តាមពិត [ការពិត] ការណែនាំជាការណែនាំនៃព្រះអាឡស់បាន។

trans-unit.source: He selects for His mercy whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: គាត់ជ្រើសរើសមេត្តាករុណារបស់ទ្រង់ដែលទ្រង់សព្វព្រះហឫ​​ទ័យ។

trans-unit.source: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth], he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a [single] silver coin, he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it]. That is because they say, "There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned." And they speak untruth about Allah while they know [it].
trans-unit.target: និងក្នុងចំណោមប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះនោះគឺអ្នកដែល, ប្រសិនបើអ្នកទុកចិត្តគាត់ដោយមានចំនួនទឹកប្រាក់យ៉ាងខ្លាំង [នៃទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិ] លោកនឹងវិលត្រឡប់វាទៅអ្នក។

trans-unit.source: But yes, whoever fulfills his commitment and fears Allah - then indeed, Allah loves those who fear Him.
trans-unit.target: ប៉ុន្តែបាទ, អ្នកណាដែលបំពេញតាមការប្តេជ្ញាចិត្តរបស់គាត់និងបានគោរពកោតខ្លាចព្រះអាឡស់ - បន្ទាប់មកពិត, ព្រះអាឡស់ស្រឡាញ់អ្នកដែលគោរពកោតខ្លាចព្រះអង្គ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allah and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់អ្នកដែលបានផ្លាស់ប្តូរសម្ពន្ធមេត្រីរបស់ព្រះអាឡស់និង [របស់ខ្លួន] ស្បថសម្រាប់តម្លៃតូចមួយនឹងមានចំណែកក្នុងអំណើះតទៅទេហើយអល់ឡោះនឹងមិននិយាយដើម្បីឱ្យពួកគេឬមើលពួកវានៅថ្ងៃនៃការរស់ឡើងវិញឬលោកនឹងបន្សុទ្ធពួកគេ

trans-unit.source: And indeed, there is among them a party who alter the Scripture with their tongues so you may think it is from the Scripture, but it is not from the Scripture. And they say, "This is from Allah," but it is not from Allah. And they speak untruth about Allah while they know.
trans-unit.target: និងការពិត, ក្នុងចំណោមពួកគេគឺមានការផ្លាស់ប្តូរបទគម្ពីរជាភាគីដែលអណ្ដាតរបស់ដូច្នេះអ្នកអាចគិតថាវាគឺជាការពីបទគម្ពីរនោះទេប៉ុន្តែវាមិនមែនមកពីគម្ពីរនេះ។

trans-unit.source: It is not for a human [prophet] that Allah should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people, "Be servants to me rather than Allah," but [instead, he would say], "Be pious scholars of the Lord because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied."
trans-unit.target: វាមិនមែនសម្រាប់ [ព្យាការី] មនុស្សដែលព្រះអាឡស់គួរតែឱ្យគាត់ព្រះគម្ពីរនិងអំណាចនិងព្យាការីហើយបន្ទាប់មកគាត់នឹងនិយាយទៅកាន់ប្រជាជនថា: «ចូរពួកអ្នកបម្រើឱ្យខ្ញុំជាជាងព្រះអាឡស់ "ប៉ុន្តែ [ជំនួសវិញ, លោកនឹងនិយាយ] ថា: «ចូរ

trans-unit.source: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords. Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?
trans-unit.target: ឬគាត់អាចបញ្ជាឱ្យអ្នកយកពួកទេវតានិងពួកព្យាការីជាព្រះអម្ចាស់។

trans-unit.source: And [recall, O People of the Scripture], when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], "Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him." [Allah] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?" They said, "We have acknowledged it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."
trans-unit.target: និង [ប្រមូលរថយន្តឱប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះ], នៅពេលដែលព្រះអាឡស់បានយកសម្ពន្ធមេត្រីរបស់ពួកព្យាការី [និយាយថា] "អ្វីដែលខ្ញុំបានផ្ដល់ឱ្យអ្នកនូវបទគម្ពីរនិងប្រាជ្ញាហើយបន្ទាប់មកមានភ្ជាប់មកដើម្បីឱ្យអ្នកផ្ញើសារបញ្ជាក់ពីអ្វីដែលមានជាមួយអ្នកអ្នក [មួយ

trans-unit.source: And whoever turned away after that - they were the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: រីឯអ្នកដែលងាកចេញឆ្ងាយបន្ទាប់ពីនោះ - ដែលពួកគេត្រូវបានគេមិនស្ដាប់បង្គាប់សេរីភាព។

trans-unit.source: So is it other than the religion of Allah they desire, while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth, willingly or by compulsion, and to Him they will be returned?
trans-unit.target: ដូច្នេះវាជាការផ្សេងទៀតជាងសាសនារបស់ព្រះអាឡស់ពួកគេចង់ខណៈពេលដែលទៅទ្រង់បានដាក់ [ទាំងអស់] ទាំងនោះនៅក្នុងផ្ទៃមេឃនិងផែនដី, ឬដោយការបង្ខិតបង្ខំដោយស្ម័គ្រចិត្ដហើយទៅទ្រង់ដែលពួកគេនឹងត្រូវបានត្រឡប់មកវិញ?

trans-unit.source: Say, "We have believed in Allah and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."
trans-unit.target: និយាយថា: «យើងបានជឿលើព្រះអាឡស់និងនៅក្នុងអ្វីដែលត្រូវបានបង្ហាញដល់យើងនិងអ្វីដែលបានបើកសម្ដែងដល់អ័ប្រាហាំ, អ៊ីស្មាអែលលោកអ៊ីសាកលោកយ៉ាកុបនិងកូនចៅនិងក្នុងអ្វីដែលត្រូវបានផ្តល់ទៅឱ្យលោកម៉ូសេនិងព្រះយេស៊ូនិងពួកព្យាការីបានមកពីព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់ពួកគេ។ យើង

trans-unit.source: And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
trans-unit.target: និងផ្សេងទៀតជាជាងអ្នកណាចង់បានសាសនាអ៊ីស្លាមជាសាសនារបស់ - មិនដែលវានឹងត្រូវបានទទួលយកពីគាត់ហើយគាត់ក្នុងការអំណើះតទៅអ្នកនោះនឹងមានក្នុងចំណោមអ្នកចាញ់។

trans-unit.source: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear signs had come to them? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: តើធ្វើដូចម្តេចព្រះអាឡស់នឹងនាំផ្លូវមនុស្សដែលមិនជឿនាងឡើយបន្ទាប់ពីជំនឿរបស់ពួកគេនិងបានឃើញផ្ទាល់ភ្នែកថាកម្មវិធីផ្ញើសារនេះគឺជាសញ្ញាពិតនិងច្បាស់លាស់បានមកដល់ពួកគេ?

trans-unit.source: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together,
trans-unit.target: អ្នកទាំងនោះ - រង្វាន់របស់ពួកគេនឹងត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ថាពួកគេគឺជាបណ្តាសាលើអល់ឡោះនិងពួកទេវតារបស់និងប្រជាជនទាំងអស់រួមគ្នា

trans-unit.source: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: ស្ថិតនៅអស់កល្បជានិច្ចនោះឡើយ។

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: លើកលែងតែសម្រាប់អ្នកទាំងឡាយដែលប្រែចិត្តបន្ទាប់ពីនោះហើយកែខ្លួនឯង។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who reject the message after their belief and then increase in disbelief - never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted, and they are the ones astray.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់ពួកអ្នកដែលបដិសេធសារជំនឿរបស់ពួកគេបន្ទាប់ពីការកើនឡើងនៅក្នុងការហើយបន្ទាប់មកបានបណ្ដុះការមិនជឿ - មិនដែលនឹង [អះអាងថា] កែប្រែចិត្ដគំនិតរបស់ពួកគេត្រូវបានទទួលយកហើយពួកគេគឺជាអ្នកដែលវង្វេង។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it. For those there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, អ្នកដែលមិនជឿហើយស្លាប់ខណៈពេលដែលពួកគេមាន disbelievers - នឹងមិនដែល [ទាំងមូល] សមត្ថភាពនៃផែនដីនៅក្នុងមាសត្រូវបានទទួលយកពីមួយនៃពួកគេប្រសិនបើលោកនឹង [ស្វែងរកការ] តម្លៃលោះខ្លួនឯងជាមួយវា។

trans-unit.source: Never will you attain the good [reward] until you spend [in the way of Allah] from that which you love. And whatever you spend - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
trans-unit.target: កុំអ្នកនឹងបាន [ទទួលរង្វាន់] ជាការល្អរហូតដល់អ្នកចំណាយពេល [នៅក្នុងវិធីនៃព្រះអាឡស់នេះ] ពីអ្វីដែលអ្នកស្រឡាញ់។

trans-unit.source: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, [O Muhammad], "So bring the Torah and recite it, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: អាហារទាំងអស់គឺសិទ្ធិកុមារនៃជនជាតិអ៊ីស្រាអែលឡើយលើកលែងតែអ្វីដែលអ៊ីស្រាអែលបានធ្វើខុសច្បាប់ដើម្បីខ្លួនគាត់មុនពេលដែលគម្ពីរវិន័យត្រូវបានគេបង្ហាញ។

trans-unit.source: And whoever invents about Allah untruth after that - then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: ហើយអ្នកណាដែលបានបង្កើតអំពីសេចក្ដីមិនពិតព្រះអាឡស់បន្ទាប់ពីនោះ - បន្ទាប់មកអ្នកដែលមាន [ពិតជា] ធ្វើខុសដែរ។

trans-unit.source: Say, "Allah has told the truth. So follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of the polytheists."
trans-unit.target: និយាយថា«ព្រះអាឡស់បានប្រាប់ការពិតដូច្នេះតាមសាសនារបស់លោកអប្រាហាំ inclining ចំពោះសេចក្ដីពិត។ ។ ហើយគាត់មិនមែនជារបស់ polytheistic នេះ "

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Makkah - blessed and a guidance for the worlds.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់ដែលសភាជាលើកដំបូង [នៃការគោរពប្រណិប័តន៍] បានបង្កើតឡើងសម្រាប់មនុស្សជាតិនោះគឺថានៅ Makkah - ទទួលពរនិងការណែនាំសម្រាប់ពិភពលោក។

trans-unit.source: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it shall be safe. And [due] to Allah from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disbelieves - then indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: នៅក្នុងវាគឺជាសញ្ញាយ៉ាងច្បាស់ [ដូចជា] កន្លែងជំហររបស់លោកអប្រាហាំ។

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while Allah is Witness over what you do?"
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា "ឱប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះហេតុអ្វីបានជាអ្នកមិនជឿនៅក្នុងខនៃព្រះអាឡស់នៅខណៈពេលដែលព្រះអាឡស់ជាសាក្សីលើអ្វីដែលអ្នកធ្វើ?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you avert from the way of Allah those who believe, seeking to make it [seem] deviant, while you are witnesses [to the truth]? And Allah is not unaware of what you do."
trans-unit.target: បាននិយាយថា "ឱប្រជាជននៃបទគម្ពីរនេះហេតុអ្វីបានជាអ្នកបញ្ចៀសពីវិធីនៃព្រះអាឡស់អស់អ្នកដែលបានជឿនោះស្វែងរកការធ្វើឱ្យវា [ហាក់] ខុសពីធម្មតារបស់ខ្ញុំខណៈពេលដែលអ្នកជាសាក្សី [សេចក្ដីពិត]? ហើយព្រះអាឡស់គឺមិនមែនជាមិនដឹងពីអ្វីដែលអ្នកបានធ្វើ

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back, after your belief, [to being] unbelievers.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿថាប្រសិនបើអ្នកប្រតិបត្តិតាមគណបក្សរបស់ពួកអ្នកដែលត្រូវបានផ្តល់បទគម្ពីរនេះជាមួយពួកគេនឹងត្រឡប់មកអ្នកវិញបន្ទាប់ពីជំនឿរបស់អ្នក [ដើម្បីធ្វើជា] មិនជឿ។

trans-unit.source: And how could you disbelieve while to you are being recited the verses of Allah and among you is His Messenger? And whoever holds firmly to Allah has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: ហើយរបៀបដែលអ្នកអាចមិនជឿខណៈពេលដើម្បីឱ្យអ្នកកំពុងត្រូវបានរៀបរាប់ខនៃព្រះអាឡស់និងកម្មវិធីផ្ញើសារក្នុងចំណោមអ្នករាល់គ្នាជារបស់លោក?

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿហើយត្រូវគោរពកោតខ្លាចព្រះអាឡស់ដូចដែលគាត់គួរតែត្រូវភ័យខ្លាចនិងមិនលើកលែងតែប្រជាជនម៉ូស្លីមស្លាប់ [ក្នុងការដាក់ស្នើដល់ទ្រង់] ។

trans-unit.source: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.
trans-unit.target: និងសង្កត់យ៉ាងរឹងមាំទៅមិនទាន់មានច្បាប់ប្រឆាំងនៃព្រះអាឡស់ទាំងអស់គ្នានិងមិនក្លាយជាការបែងចែក។

trans-unit.source: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: ហើយសូមឱ្យមាន [កើតឡើង] ពីអ្នកប្រជាជាតិបានអញ្ជើញទៅជាមួយ [ទាំងអស់នោះគឺ] ល្អ enjoining អ្វីដែលត្រឹមត្រូវនិងហាមអ្វីដែលខុសនិងអ្នកដែលនឹងទទួលបានជោគជ័យនោះទេ។

trans-unit.source: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: និងមិនមានដូចជាអ្នកដែលបានបែកញែកនិងខុសគ្នាបន្ទាប់ពីការបញ្ជាក់បានមកដល់ពួកគេ។

trans-unit.source: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said], "Did you disbelieve after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject."
trans-unit.target: នៅថ្ងៃដែល [ចំនួន] មុខនឹងបង្វែរសនិង [ចំនួន] មុខនឹងក្លាយខ្មៅ។

trans-unit.source: But as for those whose faces will turn white, [they will be] within the mercy of Allah. They will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: ប៉ុន្តែសម្រាប់អ្នកដែលមានមុខនឹងបើកស [ពួកគេនឹងក្លាយ] នៅក្នុងសេចក្ដីមេត្ដាករុណារបស់អល់ឡោះ។

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of Allah. We recite them to you, [O Muhammad], in truth; and Allah wants no injustice to the worlds.
trans-unit.target: ទាំងនេះគឺជាខគម្ពីរនៃព្រះអាឡស់បាន។

trans-unit.source: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to Allah will [all] matters be returned.
trans-unit.target: អល់ឡោះជាកម្មសិទ្ធិរបស់អ្វីដែលមាននៅលើមេឃនិងអ្វីដែលមាននៅលើផែនដី។

trans-unit.source: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: អ្នកគឺជាប្រទេសដែលល្អបំផុតដែលបានផលិត [ជាឧទាហរណ៍] ចំពោះមនុស្សជាតិ។

trans-unit.source: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance. And if they fight you, they will show you their backs; then they will not be aided.
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេនឹងមិនប៉ះពាល់ដល់អ្នកលើកលែងតែសម្រាប់ការរំខាន [មួយចំនួន] ។

trans-unit.source: They have been put under humiliation [by Allah] wherever they are overtaken, except for a covenant from Allah and a rope from the Muslims. And they have drawn upon themselves anger from Allah and have been put under destitution. That is because they disbelieved in the verses of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេត្រូវបានដាក់នៅក្រោមភាពអាម៉ាស់ [ដោយព្រះអាឡស់] គ្រប់ទីកន្លែងដែលពួកគេកំពុងវ៉ាដាច់, លើកលែងតែសម្រាប់សម្ពន្ធមេត្រីមួយពីព្រះអាឡស់និងមិនទាន់មានច្បាប់ប្រឆាំងពីម៉ូស្លីមមួយនេះ។

trans-unit.source: They are not [all] the same; among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience], reciting the verses of Allah during periods of the night and prostrating [in prayer].
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេមិនមាន [ទាំងអស់] ដូចគ្នា;

trans-unit.source: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and hasten to good deeds. And those are among the righteous.
trans-unit.target: ពួកគេជឿថានៅក្នុងព្រះអាឡស់និងថ្ងៃចុងក្រោយហើយពួកគេបានរំលឹកដាស់តឿនអ្វីដែលត្រឹមត្រូវហើយមិនត្រូវហាមឃាត់អ្វីដែលខុសនិងការពន្លឿនការប្រព្រឹត្ដល្អ។

trans-unit.source: And whatever good they do - never will it be removed from them. And Allah is Knowing of the righteous.
trans-unit.target: និងល្អអ្វីដែលពួកគេធ្វើ - មិនដែលនឹងវាត្រូវបានយកចេញពីពួកគេ។

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: ជាការពិតណាស់, អ្នកដែលមិនជឿ - មិនដែលនឹងទ្រព្យសម្បត្តិឬកូនរបស់ពួកគេទទួលពួកគេប្រឆាំងនឹងព្រះអាឡស់នៅទាំងអស់និងអ្នកដែលមានគូកននៃអគ្គីភ័យនេះ;

trans-unit.source: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys it. And Allah has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.
trans-unit.target: ឧទាហរណ៍នៃអ្វីដែលពួកគេបានចំណាយនៅក្នុងជីវិតរបស់លោកីយនេះគឺដូចជាការសាយសត្វដែលកើតមានខ្យល់មានការប្រមូលផលនៃមនុស្សដែលបានធ្វើខុសនឹងខ្លួនគេនិងបំផ្លាញវានោះទេ។

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you will use reason.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿមិនយកជាការ intimates ទាំងនោះផ្សេងទៀតជាងខ្លួនគេមុខជាពុំទុកអ្នក [មាន] ប្រាសាទបុរាណ។

trans-unit.source: Here you are loving them but they are not loving you, while you believe in the Scripture - all of it. And when they meet you, they say, "We believe." But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you in rage. Say, "Die in your rage. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts."
trans-unit.target: នៅទីនេះអ្នកកំពុងតែស្រឡាញ់ពួកគេប៉ុន្តែពួកគេមិនស្រឡាញ់អ្នកខណៈពេលដែលអ្នកជឿថានៅក្នុងបទគម្ពីរនេះ - ទាំងអស់របស់វា។

trans-unit.source: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. And if you are patient and fear Allah, their plot will not harm you at all. Indeed, Allah is encompassing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: ប្រសិនបើមានការប៉ះល្អអ្នក, វាពួកគេរងទុក្ខវេទនា!

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when you, [O Muhammad], left your family in the morning to post the believers at their stations for the battle [of Uhud] - and Allah is Hearing and Knowing -
trans-unit.target: និង [ចងចាំ] នៅពេលដែលអ្នក [ឱលោក Muhammad] បានចាកចេញពីក្រុមគ្រួសាររបស់អ្នកនៅក្នុងពេលព្រឹកដើម្បីប្រកាសជឿនៅស្ថានីយ៍របស់ខ្លួនសម្រាប់ការប្រយុទ្ធ [នៃ Uhud] - ហើយអល់ឡោះជាសវនាការនិងដឹង -

trans-unit.source: When two parties among you were about to lose courage, but Allah was their ally; and upon Allah the believers should rely.
trans-unit.target: នៅពេលដែលគណបក្សទាំងពីរនៅក្នុងចំណោមអ្នកត្រូវបានគេអំពីការបាត់បង់ភាពក្លាហាននោះទេប៉ុន្តែព្រះអាឡស់គឺជាសម្ព័ន្ធមិត្តរបស់ពួកគេ;

trans-unit.source: And already had Allah given you victory at [the battle of] Badr while you were few in number. Then fear Allah; perhaps you will be grateful.
trans-unit.target: អល់ឡោះដែលបានផ្តល់ឱ្យនិងបានទទួលជ័យជម្នះនៅក្នុងអ្នករួចទៅហើយ [សមរភូមិនៃការ] លោក Badr ខណៈពេលដែលអ្នកមានចំនួនតិច។

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you said to the believers, "Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?
trans-unit.target: [ចាំ] នៅពេលដែលអ្នកនិយាយទៅកាន់អ្នកជឿនោះថា: «តើវាមិនគ្រប់គ្រាន់សម្រាប់អ្នកថាព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់អ្នកគួរតែពង្រឹងអ្នកជាមួយនឹងពួកទេវតាធ្លាក់ចុះចំនួនបីពាន់នាក់ដែលបានផ្ញើ?

trans-unit.source: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of Allah and the enemy come upon you [attacking] in rage, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]
trans-unit.target: បាទ, ប្រសិនបើអ្នកនៅតែមានការអត់ធ្មត់និងការយល់ដឹងរបស់អល់ឡោះហើយសត្រូវមកលើអ្នក [ការវាយប្រហារ] ក្នុងកំហឹងជាព្រះអម្ចាស់របស់អ្នកនឹងពង្រឹងអ្នកជាមួយនឹងពួកទេវតាចំនួនប្រាំពាន់នាក់ដែលមានសញ្ញា [នៃការវែកញែក]

trans-unit.source: And Allah made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not except from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise -
trans-unit.target: ហើយអល់ឡោះបានធ្វើឱ្យវាមិនលើកលែងតែជាការ [សញ្ញានៃការ] ដំណឹងល្អសម្រាប់អ្នកនិងដើម្បីធានាដល់ចិត្តរបស់អ្នកដោយហេតុនេះ។

trans-unit.source: That He might cut down a section of the disbelievers or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed.
trans-unit.target: ថាទ្រង់អាចនឹងកាត់បន្ថយការធ្លាក់ចុះផ្នែកនៃ disbelievers ឬគាបសង្កត់ពួកគេដូច្នេះពួកគេបានក្លាយជាការខកចិត្តដែលបានត្រឡប់មកវិញ។

trans-unit.source: Not for you, [O Muhammad, but for Allah], is the decision whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them, for indeed, they are wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: មិនមែនសម្រាប់អ្នក, [ឱលោក Muhammad, ប៉ុន្តែសម្រាប់ព្រះអាឡស់] ជាការសម្រេចចិត្តថាតើគាត់គួរតែ [កាត់បន្ថយពួកគេធ្លាក់ចុះ] ឬអត់ទោសឬដាក់ទោសពួកគេសម្រាប់ការពិត, ពួកគេគឺជាអ្នកដែលធ្វើខុសនោះទេ។

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: និងអល់ឡោះជាកម្មសិទ្ធិរបស់អ្វីដែលមាននៅលើមេឃនិងអ្វីដែលមាននៅលើផែនដី។

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not consume usury, doubled and multiplied, but fear Allah that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: ឱអ្នកដែលបានជឿ, មិនប្រើប្រាស់ខ្ចី, ទ្វេដងហើយគុណនោះទេប៉ុន្តែការភ័យខ្លាចព្រះអាឡស់ដែលអ្នកអាចនឹងទទួលបានជោគជ័យ។

trans-unit.source: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disbelievers.
